name: Comoros
description: Comoros, an archipelago nation in the Indian Ocean, comprises three main islands – Grande Comore, Anjouan, and Mohéli – and several smaller islets.  Characterized by volcanic origins and a tropical climate, Comoros boasts stunning coral reefs, lush rainforests, and unique endemic flora and fauna.  The country’s economy relies heavily on agriculture, particularly vanilla, cloves, and ylang-ylang, alongside fishing and tourism.  Comoros is a multi-ethnic nation with a rich cultural heritage influenced by Arab, African, and French traditions.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city and largest settlement, serving as the political and economic center.
quickFacts.detail: Moroni is situated on Grande Comore and is known for its vibrant markets, historic mosques, and French colonial architecture.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small population spread across the three main islands.
quickFacts.detail: The population is diverse, with Comorian, Mozambican, and French influences.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A geographically fragmented nation with limited land area.
quickFacts.detail: The islands collectively offer a diverse landscape, from volcanic peaks to coral atolls.

quickFacts.label: Official Languages
quickFacts.description: Three official languages reflect the country's diverse cultural influences.
quickFacts.detail: Comorian is the national language, while French is widely used in business and administration.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The local currency, primarily used alongside the French Franc.
quickFacts.detail: The Frieda is pegged to the Euro.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: A developing economy with a reliance on agriculture and tourism.
quickFacts.detail: Vanilla and cloves are key export commodities.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Comoros experiences a tropical climate with consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the cyclone season (November to April).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season offers pleasant weather with lower humidity and less rainfall. It's ideal for exploring the islands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Cyclone Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This period is characterized by frequent cyclones and heavy rainfall. Travel during this time is strongly discouraged.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy downpours and high humidity. While it can be challenging, it also contributes to the lush vegetation.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Karthala
naturalWonders.description: Mount Karthala is an active stratovolcano located on Grande Comore. It’s the highest point in Comoros and a significant geological feature.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The volcano is characterized by a large caldera filled with a crater lake. Eruptions are relatively infrequent but can be dramatic, releasing sulfurous fumes. The surrounding area is a unique ecosystem adapted to volcanic conditions.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for safety and knowledge.
Bring appropriate clothing for varying weather conditions.

naturalWonders.name: Coral Reefs of Anjouan
naturalWonders.description: The coral reefs surrounding Anjouan Island are a vibrant underwater ecosystem teeming with marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These reefs offer exceptional snorkeling and diving opportunities, showcasing a diverse array of coral species, colorful fish, and other marine creatures. The reefs are relatively pristine and contribute significantly to the island's biodiversity.

ecosystemData.title: Island Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Comoros’ islands support a range of unique ecosystems, including rainforests, coral reefs, and volcanic landscapes. These ecosystems are home to a remarkable diversity of flora and fauna, many of which are endemic to the region.

biodiversityCategories.name: Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: The islands boast a rich flora, including numerous endemic tree species, orchids, and ferns.

statistics.details: Many tree species are found nowhere else on Earth.
A significant number of orchid species are endemic.

notableSpecies.name: Comorian Red Colobus
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered primate endemic to Comoros.

notableSpecies.name: Vanilla Orchid
notableSpecies.significance: A fragrant orchid species used in the production of vanilla.

biodiversityCategories.name: Fauna
biodiversityCategories.description: Comoros is a haven for birdlife, with numerous endemic bird species and migratory birds.

statistics.details: Many bird species are found only in Comoros.

notableSpecies.name: White-tailed Tropicbird
notableSpecies.significance: A seabird known for its spectacular aerial displays.

notableSpecies.name: Comoros Island Heron
notableSpecies.significance: A heron species found only in Comoros.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities
activities.description: Comoros offers a range of outdoor activities for adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the volcanic landscapes and rainforests of the islands.

activities.name: Mount Karthala Ascent
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Mount Karthala, offering stunning views.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, appropriate clothing.

activities.name: Coastal Trails
activities.description: Explore the coastal trails of Anjouan and Mohéli, discovering hidden beaches and viewpoints.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters surrounding the islands.

activities.name: Snorkeling & Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Paddle along the coastline and explore hidden coves.

clothing.winter: Long-sleeved shirts, trousers, light jacket, rain gear.
clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, sandals, insect repellent.

equipment.basic: Passport, visa (if required), travel insurance, cash.
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, backpack, water bottle, map, compass.
